lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: The classroom grows quiet. The teacher enters briskly, dropping a folder on the desk.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.text: Alright, listen up. This is important.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.text: This Friday, you’ll be taking your Final Exams — standardized, written, no room for games.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.text: You’ll get to pick two subjects. We’ve submitted your preferences, but the responsibility is yours.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.text: Your results go directly on your Grade Transcript. These grades will affect your scholarship chances and more.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.text: Choose wisely — and study. No second chances.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.text: And now... the Principal would like to have a few words.

lines.speaker: Narrator
lines.text: She steps aside as the Principal enters the classroom.

lines.speaker: Principal
lines.text: Today we received a new call for a super scholarship to study at a prestigious university abroad. You’ll get free education and accommodation if you meet the following criteria:

lines.speaker: Principal
lines.text: – An average grade of 4.50 or higher in the subjects related to the field of study you’re applying for.

lines.speaker: Principal
lines.text: – Submission of an application for university admission (CV, motivation letter, etc.).

lines.speaker: Principal
lines.text: – A certificate proving your knowledge of the language in which the program will be taught.

lines.speaker: Principal
lines.text: Unfortunately, the deadline to submit all documents is just one week, so act quickly!

lines.speaker: Principal
lines.text: For more information, feel free to visit the secretary.
